message.content:
cs.PL, cs.AR, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the use of functional programming models for achieving performance portability on parallel devices, which falls under the category of programming languages (cs.PL) and architecture (cs.AR). The paper also presents a formalised translation process for preserving parallelisation strategies, which involves software engineering (cs.SE) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper includes performance results, which could be relevant to machine learning (cs.LG) applications.
